p: Researchers are attempting to improve the immune system against COVID-19 and here some of the data reviewed. Ten proteins are encoded by the COVID-19 genome; one of them is the S protein, as aforementioned, because a glycoprotein exists in the virus-infected region ( Fig. 6 ). The S protein is a significant therapeutic target, ensured its location, and targetable using antibodies [ 93]. The formation of neutralizing antibodies’ immunization of animals with S protein-oriented vaccines is very effective in preventing infection by homologous coronavirus [ 94]. If human cells are infected by virus entities, epitopes from any of that viruses’ proteins can theoretically be bound and presented by MHC-1 receptors on host cell surfaces, leading to the stimulation of CD4 and CD8 T cells to provoke antibody-mediated and cell-mediated immune responses.
